course_title: Community Building and Social Change I - Principles and Perspectives
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 10 / Seats Avail: 9Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as POLS 370A 1, CBSC 370A 1, and ENVS 370A 1)
(How communities of all sizes and types (e.g., neighborhoods, cities, metropolitan regions) solve important public problems. Our focus will be on understanding how, why, and to what effects, collaborative, community-based, cross-sector (public-private-nonprofit) initiatives are crafted to assist in the revitalization of low-income communities and their residents.)
course_description: Open only to undergraduate students by permission of the instructor. Additionally, this course is required for all students seeking to apply for the fellowship in Community Building and Social Change.
sections: Class Nbr: 4375, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: M. Rich, Status: Open
